docs.snippet: The Jets made their first cuts on Friday, shedding kicker Dan Carpenter and the veteran tackle Antonio Garay, who confirmed his release in an e-mail....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Jets made their first cuts on Friday, shedding kicker Dan Carpenter and the veteran tackle Antonio Garay, who confirmed his release in an e-mail.
docs.abstract: New York Jets release kicker Dan Carpenter and veteran tackle Antonio Garay in first cuts to trim roster to 53 players.

headline.main: Jets Trim Roster, Cutting Kicker and Veteran Tackle

docs.snippet: One day after the announcement of a $765 million settlement in a concussion lawsuit, some former players and their families expressed mixed feelings....
docs.lead_paragraph: One day after the announcement of a $765 million settlement in a concussion lawsuit, some former players and their families expressed mixed feelings.
docs.abstract: Former football players and their families express mixed reactions to $765 million settlement by NFL in massive concussion lawsuit involving 4,500 plaintiffs; some express relief that their families will have measure of financial support despite their degenerative diseases, while others are angry or disappointed that league made no official admission regarding link between players' concussions and their illnesses.

headline.main: Relief, but Disappointment, for Plaintiffs in N.F.L. Case
headline.print_headline: Relief, but Disappointment, For Plaintiffs in N.F.L. Case

byline.original: By TIM ROHAN and KEN BELSON

docs.abstract: New York Giants will wait to receive test results on running back Andre Brown's fractured leg before determining their course of action.

headline.main: Giants Take Wait-and-See Approach After Brown’s Injury
